title: Running throwing functions
postscript: You can have multiple catch blocks to handle individual errors if you want, but you do need to catch all possible errors at some point otherwise your code won't build.
question: Which of the following are true?
hint: Start a throwing block using do, mark each throwing line with try and catch errors using catch.
correct: Throwing functions must be called using try
Throwing functions must be marked with throws
Swift won't let you run an error-throwing function by accident.
Use do to start a section of code that calls throwing functions.
If any errors are thrown, execution immediately jumps to the catch block.
You can mark any function as throwing.
wrong: You can call only one throwing function inside a do block.
Swift lets you skip adding a catch block when it's safe.
You don't need to catch all errors.
You should mark all functions as throwing.
You can define only one error enum in your apps.
